name: Mobile Web Study Jam

venue.name: Mselect/Tech Hub
venue.address_2: Same building as Esporta Gym, near 100m road behind Hawler hospital

description:
• What we'll do
The Google Mobile Web Study Jam aims to teach developers how to create high quality and fast mobile sites. During this study jam, we shall be learning the best practices in mobile site development which in turn will help improve the general standard of mobile design and speed, and support the growth of the Google community in Iraq.

Today, over 50% of web traffic goes to mobile yet developers aren’t designing effectively for mbole e.g. 53% of mobile visitors will leave if a page takes more than three seconds to load. The average page takes 19 seconds to load over 3G. Speed is just one part of creating better mobile experiences and best practice has gone a long way past responsive design alone. Are you up to date?

Requirements

You need basic web development skills to take part and it typically it takes 3-4 hours to run through the course materials, followed by a 90 minute multiple choice exam. You can find more details on the course here (https://support.google.com/partners/answer/7358898?hl=en-GB&ref_topic=7359299). It’s possible to do it entirely online alone, but we’d like to run through it together as a group and support each other for this first study jam.

This is a chance to get a professional accreditation that demonstrates you have an understanding of basic and advanced aspects of mobile website design and development. By learning together, we are growing the developer community in Iraq and you'll have the chance to meet like-minded individuals!

Why do it?

There is more traffic to mobile sites than desktop, yet most sites don’t provide an effective experience for users. Best practice is changing rapidly so what people may have learned a few years ago may not be up to date. For companies and site owners we see better mobile design leading to significant and measurable improvements in customer acquisition, retention and engagement (https://developers.google.com/web/showcase).

The Mobile Sites certification is a professional accreditation that Google offers to individuals who demonstrate proficiency in basic and advanced aspects of mobile website design and development. A Mobile Sites certification allows individuals to demonstrate that Google recognizes them as an expert in mobile sites.

Benefits include:

• Certificate: Show that you're a certified mobile sites professional with a personalized certificate that you can print!

• Profile page: Share your expertise with a Google Partners public profile page that lists your certifications.

Developers that participate in the study jam and complete the exam will then become a certified mobile sites professional.

VENUE: MSELECT, Behind Hawler Hospital, 100m road

• What to bring
Laptop, pen, and notepad
how_to_find_us: Come inside the building and up the stairs to the first floor

name: IWD: Women in Tech and Entrepreneurship Summit - Sulaymaniyah

venue.name: The American University of Iraq Sulaimani (AUIS)

description:
GET TICKETS HERE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/iwd-women-in-tech-summit-sulaymaniyah-tickets-39911107196

• What we'll do

PANEL DISCUSSION: 1pm-2.30pm

In celebration of International Women's Day, the Women in Tech and Entrepreneurship Summit is designed to bring together inspiring female leaders and innovators to explore opportunities for women in technology and entrepreneurship in Iraq. This event is sponsored by AUIS, Google Developer Group and Zain Iraq, and is organised by Re:Coded and Five One Labs.

Through inspirational keynotes, panel discussions on technology and entrepreneurship, and skills and career development workshops, this event provides all the content and networking opportunities for females to flourish in the tech and startup sectors in Iraq. Key topics the panel will discuss include the digital gender gap, opportunities and challenges in the tech and startup sectors in Iraq and the importance of role models to inspire more women to enter the world of technology and entrepreneurship! Panelists include:

Safa Salwan, Founder of Women Techmakers Baghdad

Ava Nadir, Head of Zain Kurdistan Marketing Communication and PR Department

Additional speakers TBC

Tea break: 2.30pm-3pm

There will also be an opportunity to join one of two workshops to learn new skills related to programming and entrepreneurship:

Workshop 1 - Intro to Coding: Create an Android App
3pm to 4.30pm

Create your first Android application!

During our introductory workshop, you'll explore the basics of the Java programming language and XML. By writing your own lines of code, you’ll cover key coding terms and principles and develop a simple Android application

Prerequisites & Preparation
No previous programming experience is required. A laptop with Android Studio downloaded is required in order to participate in this workshop

Workshop 2 - Launching your Startup
3pm to 4.30pm

Do you have an idea for a business or project? Learn how to start it up!

During this introductory entrepreneurship workshop, you will interview customers, brainstorm innovative solutions, and develop a prototype of a potential business idea, all during the two hours. You will also be introduced to the Business Model Canvas and learn how to develop a testable business model. Note: to take part in the workshops, you must have the correct ticket. One workshop per person.

REGISTRATION ON EVENTBRITE REQUIRED TO ATTEND: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/iwd-women-in-tech-summit-sulaymaniyah-tickets-39911107196

• What to bring
If you are taking part in the coding workshop, please be sure to bring a laptop with Android Studio already downloaded

name: WTM: Women's Only Web Development Meetup

venue.name: Re:Coded
venue.address_2: 3rd floor, Nergiz Plaza (next to Saj Al Reef restaurant)

description:
• What we'll do
The Women Techmakers meetup will teach basic web development skills to women in the local community.

By the end of the meetup, you will have created a resume website which you can also use to show to prospective employers!

*FOR WOMEN ONLY*

Requirements

We only need you to bring your laptop, and your passion for learning web development!

By learning together, we are growing the developer community in Iraq and you'll have the chance to meet like-minded individuals!

Why do it?

If you're interested in web development but don't know where to start, this is a great way for you to be introduced to it and learn HTML and CSS. By the end of the meetup, you'll also have a resume website to show off your skills!

VENUE: Re:Coded, 2nd floor, Nergiz Plaza, Gulan Street (next to Saj Al Reef), Erbil.

• What to bring
Laptop
how_to_find_us: Come inside the building and up the stairs or elevator to the second floor

name: Flutter Study Jam

venue.name: Re:Coded
venue.address_2: 3rd floor, Nergiz Plaza (next to Saj Al Reef restaurant)

description:
Flutter is Google's mobile app SDK that allows you to develop applications for both Android and iOS from a single codebase.

Want to get started on building Flutter apps?

Join us for our Flutter Study Jam! Together we'll work through the Flutter Udacity Course prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals.

What to bring?

Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, the laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine. Download it from here: https://flutter.io/get-started/install/
how_to_find_us: Come inside the building and take the elevator or the stairs to the second floor.

name: International Women's Day / WTM 2019 by GDGErbil
description:
Women Techmakers, is a program initiated by Google and organized by the community to provide visibility and resources for women in tech, alongside empowering them to pursue the jobs of tomorrow —in tech— today.

This event is a milestone for women in tech because they will be part of a growing community of tech passionate youth, that will give support and resources to be involved in tech industry.

Event Agenda:
13:00 Icebreaking
13:15 Keynote
13:30 Panel Discussion
14:30 Coffee Break and networking
15:00 Web Dev Crash Course Workshop
16:50 Concluding

Our panelists are:
Zahra Shah, Country manager at Re:Coded
Shereen Messi, Software Developer at IOM Iraq
Roshna Omer, Developer at SoftMax Company

If you want to attend the workshop (Web Development Crash course) please fill the form:
https://goo.gl/forms/pjlhdCMBT7JdBGqF3

Sponsors:
Zain, Knowledge University, Re:Coded

name: Machine Learning Study Jam 2019

venue.name: Re:Coded
venue.address_2: 3rd floor, Nergiz Plaza (next to Saj Al Reef restaurant)

description:
Machine learning is the scientific study of algorithms and statistical models that computer systems use to effectively perform a specific task without using explicit instructions, relying on patterns and inference instead.

Want to get started on the machine learning?
Join us for our Machine Learning Study Jam!
Together we'll work through the Machine Learning introduction prepared by GDG Erbil instructors. You will be able to get your hands dirty with Machine Learning and start learning the fundamentals :D

Agenda:
10:00 introduction and icebreaking
10:30 Preparations and links
10:45 Presentation
12:15 Coffee break and networking
13:00 Part 2
16:45 Concluding

What to bring?
Bring a laptop and notebook!

#GDG #GDGErbil #WTM #WTMErbil #ML #MachineLearning #Tech #ZainIraq #ZYouthGotThis #Erbil #Hawler #2019
